alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 09 at 3:38AM HST until March 09 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE BIG ISLAND SUMMITS UNTIL 6 PM HST SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT UNTIL 6 PM HST TODAY... Dangerously strong winds will continue the higher elevations on the Big Island for the next several days. Winds have peaked and will be on a very slow decline through the weekend. On the summit of Haleakala on Maui, winds will continue to slowly decline today. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 50 mph with localized gusts to 60 mph. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking difficult. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Consider postponing travel to the summits until conditions improve. If you must travel to the summits, use extra caution walking and driving. Be careful opening or closing doors.
